body_content.explanation: a soldier who does jobs such as building bridges, repairing roads, and laying and clearing landmines (= underground bombs):
examples: Originally, sappers dug "saps", or trenches, to undermine the walls of fortifications.
UN-trained local sappers have located and destroyed more than 10,000 antitank mines.

body_content.explanation: a soldier in the Corps of Royal Engineers, a unit of the British Army:
examples: He was a 20-year-old sapper in the Royal Engineers.
